result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Rovaun D Alston

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Rovaun D Alston in court.  Attorney Corey R. Flynn in court for Rovaun D Alston.  Prosecuting attorney Navjot Singh Hira in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for return on doctors report.  Parties do not contest the report.   Court finds the defendant is competent to proceed and reinstates the proceedings.  Defense requests status conference date.  Case remains calendared in Branch 15.
Status conference scheduled for November 17, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Rovaun D Alston in court.  Attorney Corey R. Flynn in court for Rovaun D Alston.  Prosecuting attorney Navjot Singh Hira in court for the State of Wisconsin. Letter from Dr. Niess filed regarding defendant missing the evaluation. Defense places reasonings on the record and states that new evaluation is scheduled. Conditions of bail remain as previously set. Case is adjourned in Branch 15.
Doctor's Report Return scheduled for October 25, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Correspondence dated August 26, 2022 from Dr. Jenna Niess regarding Defendant's failure to appear for mental health evaluation; received, filed, and forwarded to the Judge for review.

Defendant Rovaun D Alston in court with attorney Corey R. Flynn.  Navjot Singh Hira appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: SD.
Additional statement by Reginald A.    Court is advised by the defense there is reason to believe the defendant is not competent to proceed.  Pursuant to Sec. 971.14 (2) Wisconsin Statutes, Court found probable cause and ordered defendant examined by Wisconsin Forensic Unit.  Order for Examination, signed and filed.  Case adjourned, Br. 15.  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for September 8, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

Attorney Corey R. Flynn in court.  Julie D Knyszek appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
CASE HELD OFF THE RECORD PER JUDGE.  Case in court for pretrial conference.  Defendant does not appear.  Court rescheduled matter to be held in person in room 623 of the Courthouse. Effective July 30, 2022, this calendar will be assigned to Judge JD Watts, Branch 15 in Room 623 of the Courthouse.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 3, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Court ordered no contact with Lennise V.
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.

Court ordered Justice Point Pretrial Services LEVEL 2 SUPERVISION.  Court reminders.
  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Rovaun D Alston in court with attorney Edgar A Beltran.  Defendant Rovaun D Alston in custody.  Sara Waldschmidt-DeSmet appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   All parties appeared by video conference.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Ashley, Branch 19. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant pled not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.
Case is adjourned to Br. 19 for pretrial.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 20, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
